CARDINAL . The applicants sought a ruling declaring that the length of the proceedings before ORG had been excessive . They asked for an award of just satisfaction in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) ( approx . ORG CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint . The court found that LAW produced legal effects as from the date of entry into force ( DATE ) , its provisions applied retroactively to all proceedings in which delays had occurred before that date and had not yet been remedied . It acknowledged that there had been a delay at the initial stage of the proceedings but found that this situation had ceased to exist when LAW entered into force .
